Aroma: Caramel and alcoholic notes.
Appearance: Dark brown color with hazy color and white head.
Taste: Light sweetness with medium bitter notes.
Palate: Medium body with oily texture and average carbonation. Bitter chocolate finish.

Verkostet im empfohlenen Maisel Kelch! Tiefdunkel bis schwarz mit cremig klebriger leckerer Schaumkrone. Malziger Antrunk, Zartbitterschokolade mit feiner Hopfennote. Ein tolles dunkles Bier aus Oberfranken.

Pours black with tan head. Sweet roasted aroma. Chocolate, coffee, toffee, candy. Medium-full body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(750 ml bottle) Black stout-like beer, with a deep ruby hue. Rocky tan-coloured head, containing bubbles of all different sizes. It leaves a good lacing up the side of the glass. 

First and foremost, an aroma of roasted malt: chocolate, coffee, and some dark wild fruit, like raspberry and blackberry. This is followed by a hint of banana, and some warm spices - cinnamon and clove. The taste is quite sweet, but also a little acidic. The finish is slightly bitter, with some underlying earthiness, minerals and oak.

This is a pleasant, roasty bock, but a little too acidic. The fact that Maisel & Friends have developed such a rich, chocolatey bock despite the restrictions of the Reinheitsgebot is simply amazing.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 Særdeles spændende Dunkel Bock. Meget robust øl, med en fin sødlig smag ag chokolade. Pænt udseende.
Sötétbarna szín. Étcsokoládés, pörkölt aroma plusz némi erdei gyümölcs. Inkább a keserű felé hajlik, de némi édesség is megbújik a háttérben. Karácsonykor jó kísérője volt a sültnek.

Közepes, nem túl tartós hab, sötétbarna szín. Karamelles, gyümölcsös illat. Karamelles, csokis, gyümölcsös ízvilág, halvány fűszerességgel és némi mogyorós, mandulás lecsengéssel. Közepesen testes, közepesen szénsavas, enyhén kesernyés. Nagyon finom, jól eltalált sör, nagyon jó egyensúllyal és arányokkal.

Thanks to whoever brought this. Murky dark brown body. Big lasting off white head. Nice chocolate/cocoa/malty aroma. Chocolate flavored cereal sweetish taste. Light and nice. Just too light in the finish. But nice!
smells like cold coffee, espresso, warm in alcohol, ggod body, roasty, fruit
Malzfruchtiger Geruch. Antrunk süßlich-malzig. Mitte stark röstig, Kaffee, Schokolade. Abgang röstig-bitter, malzig, schokoladig. Sehr gut.

0.75 l bottle shared with friends. Deep brown coloured with beige head. Malts, roasted malts and strong chocolate in aroma. Bitter and sweet chocolate and roasted malts in taste withc chocolate finish. Soft carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, medium body. Nice.

Nice big bottle but without detail information about the malts, hops and drinktemperature.
Black beer with cappuccino head, Smell is dark chocolate and smoke, taste is dark chocolate and dark fruits, good balance, not too much, full body, texture is oily and not too much, 
(I have 0.75l bottle with best-before 13.10.2018 01:44)

Along with Yves at home philip 0,75l bottle of dark brown colored body with a off white head and a roasted malt chocolate aroma a roasted malt herby bitter sweet chocolate taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Shared with wim at phils place. Dark brown colored beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Chocolate malty aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is sweet dry bit bitter chocolate hinted.
厚實穩重，卻
Its like a liquid brownie, strong roasted sunflower seeds aroma with plenty of chocolate and sweetness

Black beer with a medium to big sized, good lasting, brown head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee powder, malt, caramel, rum cherry, some sugary sweetness in the beginning, licorice and lovage with rising temperature. Taste is full of dark chocolate and coffee, some light sweetness in finish, lasting roast malt character. Some warming alcohol. Soft carbonation, medium body, oily texture.
En super god chokolade Bock. Passer perfekt til noget godt chokolade eller kage.

Im buy this beer on autumn about one year ago in some Getranke shop in Essen. Wyglad ciemno brazowy z niewielkimi refleksami burgundzkiej czerwieni, piana bezowa spora szybko narasta, ale jest srednio trwala. Zapach daktyli, sliwek i czekolady. W smaku rumiany tost posmarowany nutella, daktyle, sliwki w czekoladzie, lukrecja i znow czekolada deserowa. Chmielnosc niewielka, jest pewna wytrawnosc, ale dominuje tu slodowosc czekoadowa. Porzadne piwo
19-10-16 // 750ml bottle shared. pours a dark brown black beer. Small beige head. Light chocolate in the nose. Taste of roasted matls, some caramel, chocolate, bitter chocolate. Nice one.

Quite good cream-coloured head, dense, slowly retreating over pitch-black beer. Chocolate² (bitter and milk), and quite a bit smoked. Roasted, dark malts. Slightly sourish-roasted overlying again sweet-bitterish chocolated notes. Peeled walnut, bit of coffee. Very well-carbonated, spritzy, very slick to viscous, well-bodied. Another excellent Maisel turnout. I dont understand their dropping of the Dampfbier, but I like their turn towards craft!
Nesten svart med et lite rødskjær. Kompakt, off-white skum. Bitter kaffe, sjokolade og karamell i duften. Kaffe og mørke bær i smaken med fløyelsmyk sjokolade i avslutningen. Denne gled rett ned.

Mélybarna, puha habot generáló főzet csokoládészeletes, nápolyis, magvas, diós illatokkal, amolyan lágeres stílusban, egyszerűbbnek ható vonalvezetéssel. Ízvilága hasonlóképpen alakul, az összetevők az édesen pörkölt maláta kissé egyhangú karakterének mondanivalója körül forognak, ostyás, kartonpapíros jegyekkel megspékelve, a sötétebb környezetért kiáltó elemeket légiesen könnyed testbe zárva. Mintha az alkohol lába is kissé kikandikálna, szertelen, de azért szimpatikus az ital.

Rating #2129 - 2015.10.16 - Draught @revolutionyeg - Dark brown pour with a tan head that fades fairly slowly. Mild-medium carbonation. Aroma is cocoa, hint of toffee and roasted malt. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate syrupy sweetness leading to a dry, yet balanced finish. Malty sweetness lingers on the pallet leaving you yearning for another glass. Delightful.

Bottle. Dark brown color, creamy foam. Aroma: malt, chocolate, caramel, wine, dried fruits. Taste: real chocolate, wine, malty, coffee, sweet. Very good.

Bottle, 750 ml from Ammersin, Wien. Shared with JFK10000 and Miro B. Pours dark brown with light brownish small creamy head. Malty, light roastiness, chocolate, bready. Sweetish with light bitterness in finish. Medium bodied.

Next notes of bread and cereal characteristic for bock are on the first plan. Semisweet in taste with notes of bread, cereal, a bit chocolate and roasty in the background. Small alcohol is perceptible and burns a bit in the throat but generally is quite nice. Beer is medium body, average of carbonation, malty but quite drinkable. Generally there is realy good bock with delicate accent of chocolate.

Botella. Bonito color a café con espuma persistente. Aroma muy agradable a regaliz, café y chocolate. En boca, muy buena. Destaca aún más el regaliz y deja un postgusto dulce a chocolate muy lleno en sabor. Perfecta para postres. Recuerda a un px.

Bottle. 7.5%. Best before 24.01.17. Pours a clear, dark red/brown, with a light tan head. Good lacing. Aroma is malt and dark (bordering overripe) fruits. Hint of chocolate. A bit dusty. Sweetish flavour, with dark fruits and a light chocolate note. Hint of blue cheese popping out once in a while. A bit of rye as it warms. Dark fruit finish with a lingering green apple note and a light alcohol burn. Somewhat dry. A wee bit too much carbonation at first, but dies down over time and leaves the mouthfeel somewhat velvety. Overall okay, and well-made, but also a bit generic. Also, could do with a bit more chocolate. 25.03.16.

Aroma: intense chocolate, milk chocolate, caramel, dark malts. Appearance: black, massive, frothy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: intense chocolate again, pralines, dark grains, cacao. Overall: beautiful Dunkler Bock, great chocolate flavours throughout. Bottle from Lidl, Thun.

The nose is dominated by caramel malts and it starts with that in the mouth too. Letting the beer warm up from fridge temperature closer to room temperature brought out lots of more flavor. The advertised chocolate is there and so is the hint of berries. Very delicious combination carried by a nice full body. We finished the bottle pretty quickly! Definitely recommended!

Bottle from a licor store in Rhenoy, Netherlands. 
The beer is deep dark brown colored, a little hazy, and with a small cream colored head. Carbonation is a little low.
The aroma is sweet with tones of caramel and roasted malts, but also hints of a stout like chocolate, cacao and strong espresso.
The taste starts with full bodied sweetness from the caramel. After that, it changes into a bitterness which reminds me of a stout, with nice chocolate and coffee notes. Nice balance between them.
The finish is dry and light bitter, which is long noticable.

Piwo pite dzięki @ArtificialCyst , prost! Doskonałe piwo, piana gęsta, dość szybko opadająca, oblepia ścianki szkła. W aromacie fajna kawa zbożowa, gorzka czekolada, karmel, lekka alkoholowość. W smaku bardzo ułożone, gorzka czekolada miesza się z karmelem, goryczka alkoholowa. Piwo gęste, oblepia kubki smakowe.

Flasche (75 cl) von Getränke Ganick, Berlin. - Tief kastanienbraun, schwach trüb; dunkelbeigefarbener Schaum. - In der Nase milde Bitterschokolade, schwach säuerlicher Kaffee, Dunkelmalz und ganz milder Hopfen. - Antrunk schön füllig mit warmem Röstmalz und breiter, weicher Malzsüße (Rohrzucker). Mild rezent, kremiges Mundgefühl. Im weiteren Verlauf schöne Kaffeebittere, fein abgeschmeckt mit zarter fruchtiger Säure. Die Röstnoten sind prägnant aber nirgends herb und bleiben bis in den Abgang dominierend. Hopfen kommt nur schwach im Hintergrund vor, wird aber bei dieser prächtigen Malzigkeit auch kaum vermißt. Immerhin schwach holzige Herbe im Ausklang. Etwas zu milder Nachtrunk. Trotz 7,5 % überhaupt nicht fuselig. - Lecker dunkelmalzig-süßer und schön schokoladiger, mild röstiger Bock, dem man das Fehlen von kernigen Hopfenaromen nachsehen kann. Aber warum spricht das Etikett von irischem Stout? Das ist doch ein typischer deutscher Doppelbock.

Casi negra y opaca. Espuma ocre. Rico aroma tostado, con clara notas de chocolate. En boca presenta buen cuerpo y gas, y excelente sabor muy equilibrado. Creemosa. Claro chocolate predominante sobre todo al final del trago, llenando el paladar. Dulce y amarga a la vez. Y cierta acidez frutal contenida que redondea el conjunto. Algo licórica pero alcohol bien disimulado. Muy buena.

Smooth and creamy, rich yet easy drinking body. A well crafted beer.

This is simply a high class Irish Stout with a full round body, extreme smoothness and an explosion of roast coffee, malt and dark bitter chocolate with a touch of sweetness reflecting caramel or wildberries. A great composition of a beer that feels quite unique and special.

Dark brown colour. Malty aroma. Sweet malty flavour with plenty of cocoa. Quite a rich feel.
Pitch black color with light brown color. Bitter chocolate smell. The taste is basically the same. Quite pleasant aftertaste as well.
Dark brown color with nice beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate. Taste is dark malts, bitter chocolate, nice dry bitter finish. Very full-bodied. A really good dark bock.
Out of bottle. Pours with nice head. Incredible coffee chocolate nose that carries over to the taste. Great-great stout. Love it
750cc bottle. Pours black with beige creamy thick head. Its starts like milk chocolate then in the mouth evolves into coffee and berries and then finishes like bitter cocoa. Just outstanding.

Tiefdunkel, fast schwarz mit hellbraunem Schaum. Tolle Aromen nach Röstmalz, etwas Kaffee. Der Antrunk ist wuchtig. Etwas Bittere und Süße, dann eine enorme Portion Röstmalz. Espresso und Zartbitterschokolade. Die Röstaromen halten sich neben einer leichten Säure und wirken lange nach. 
Top!

Bottled. 75cl sample (!) The aroma has chocolate, roast, moccha, hint of raisin. Black coloured beer with a beautiful beige, creamy head. The taste is light sweet, has little bitterness, chocolate, light roast, bread. Very easy going stout considering its ABV and creamy malty nature. I opened this bottle with my wife who doesnt like stouts so she had something else. I wasnt sure if I could fully finish it, but was disappointed when the bottle was empty. Just awesome. Bit strange is that its called a bock while the flavour text clearly states it should be an Irish stout. Guess this is probably to prevent scaring off Reinheitsgebot-dogmatic Germans.
Drank at Rik on Easter. Nice thick beer. Great body. Chocolate taste coffee aftertaste.

Dark brown color, hazy; tan head - intense aroma of toasted malt, dark chocolate, some hints of dark fruits and grassy hops - slightly sweet and medium bitter taste - full boy, thick and creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation - bitter finish with hints of toasted malt.
Bottle from el corte ingles, lisboa, portugal. Dark copper to brown color. Thin beige head. Medium body. Aroma is roasted, chocolate, malty.

(75 cl bottle; BBD: October 1st 2016) Poured into original Maisel glass revealing a cloudy dark brown body with tan, one-finger head. Decent retention and nice lace. Aroma is toasted malt with a slight hint of wet dog. Oily texture, medium body, soft carbonation and a toasted finish. Flavour is somewhat sweet with a complementary foastedness. Decent.

75cl bottle from Hipercor. @home 29-03-2015.
BBD: 08-05-2016.
In short: tasty sweet dark beer.
Pours dark copper with frothy tan head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Roasty, liquorice, caramel and chocolate aromas.Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is roasty, sweet, little bitterness, chocolate, milky. Smooth and viscous palate, quite enjoyable.
Black body, huge and lasting brown head. Aroma of roasted malts. Bittersweet taste of bad coffee, short spicy finish. Meh.
i absolutely adore this one, a very balanced stout with a classy but fine decent choc taste - a strong but perfect carbination ever present. Wow. Top beer.

bottle at 87, Stuttgart. dark brown color, light tan head. smells roasty, malty, coffee, light white chocolate. full body, creamy, alcoholic, malty, sweetness, bubbly, light bitter/sweet chocolate/cocoa finish. good smell, but taste too alcoholic and I did not like the finish.

Bottle at Craigs house. 
Appearance - opaque black with a thin crema head. 
Nose - toffee with a yeasty edge. 
Taste - light toffee, maybe butterscotch. Creamy backdrop.
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy sweet texture and a fairly good finish if a little sweet. 
Overall - a bit too sweet for a medium body.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours murky dark brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of brown sugar, light herbs. Taste is sweet, light vinegar. Finishes sour. Not much chocolate.

bottle at home ... deep brown black ... big tan head ... soft dark roat malt ... soft chocolate roast ... dark malts .. grassy fruits ... dark malts .. soft mlts ... sweet roast ... dark malts ... ssoft blackcurrnt ... dark roast
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Yeasty aroma, minerals. Taste of yeast, earth. Bleurgh
Bottle at Craigs. Pours deep brown, nose is sweet chocolate roast, taste is sweet, chocolate, malty toffee.

Poors black with a light brown, medium stable head. Aroma has raised malt, indeed dark chocolate and some bread. Taste is very sweet. Unusually for a Bock there is some bitterness which fits surprisingly good.

Draught at Taphouse.
Clear red-brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel and chocolate with notes of bread.
Sweet and malty flavour of caramel, dried fruits and bread.
Sweet finish.

750 mml bottle tasted on the 24/01/2015. Dark Colour with a smooth beige head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts and pine. Taste is a lot of chocolate with little licorice and roasted malts. Some chocolate sediments? Nice carbonation. Aftertaste is unidimensional. Next one please!

Bottle. Deep brown with a huge beige head. Aroma of cherries, chocolate, dried fruits, honey and yeast. Sweet with a solid malty backbone, flavors of caramel, coffee, dried fruits, medium herbal bitterness. Medium-bodied, well carbonated. Decent.

Bottle 750ml. Dark brown with big yellowish head. Fruity aroma (green apple, cherry), vinegar notes, some maltiness and a bit yeasty. Sweetish flavor, fruity (cherry, pear), hint of milk chocolate, creamy, notes of caramel, light sourness with some herbs in the finish. Moderate carbonation, medium-bodied.

Dark murky brown with a nice tan head. Aroma sweet with notes of dark caramels, dark fruit, chocolate, and roast. Taste roasty, full, lots of caramel, milk chocolate, and sweet. Nice beer for cold weather.

Cervesa molt ben equilibrada, destaquen sobretot tocs a xocolata i a fruits secs, evoluciona molt bé.
Cerveza muy bien equilibrada, destacan sobretodo toques a chocolate y a frutos secos, evoluciona muy bien.

Bottle-thanks, cgreb! Bitter chocolate and faint spicy hops aroma. Persistent light brown foam top. Bitter chocolate flavour with dunklesbier malt accents; bread crust, dried fruit, sherry-like nuts. Medium light body, medium body, sweet finish.

bottle @ friends. Appearance: pours clear dark brown with ok creamy off-white head with some lacing. aroma/taste: grain, caramel, chocolate, nuts, berries/raisins, oak and hints of floral notes. palette: medium carbonation, medium body, distinct caramel sweetness, average bitterness, medium to long duration and an oliy texture. Overall: tasteful and relatively complex bock.
Smell of chocolate, malt. Dark brown colour, high brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla. Sweet, with some bitterness. Soft carbon. Oily and somewhat velvety texture.
Bottle. Color hazy dark brown with big brown head. Aroma malt, toffee, caramel. Taste caramel, bread, bitter.
Correct beer, not as good as expected, maybe because of its texture, watery. The aromas and traste remind of coffee more than chocolate. Good, thats all.

Drobna, beżowa piana. Trwała i zdobi szkło. 
Kolor brunatny, nieprzejrzysty. Zmętnione. 
W aromacie gorzka czekolada i nuty koźlaka. W drugiej nucie lekki karmel. 
Lekka kwaskowość od ciemnych słodów. 
W smaku czekoladowe, z nutami skórki od chleba. W kolejnych łykach czuć chmiel.
Wysycenie średnie. 
Alkohol dobrze zamaskowany. Zaczyna wychodzić lekko w miarę ogrzewania.

Bottle at Pigs Ear 2014, thanks to Jackie & Simon. It pours murky deep brown with a small beige head. The nose is earthy, wood, sweet caramel, chocolate, dried fruits and dull toasty smoke. The taste is sweet, toasty, booze boost, raisin, sultana, chocolate, roast, pepper and chewy malt with sweet, warming finish. Medium+ body, fine carbonation and sticky mouth-feel. A touch sweet & hot, but not bad.
Clar dark brow, cappuccino head. Roasted malts, chocolate and a hint of mon cherie, hint of licorice. Full body, roasted malts with burnt wood,, light chocolate and caramel, licorice. Well balanced.

2nd December 2014Pigs Ear. Bottle share thanks to Jackie and Simon. Murky dark amber beer, small pale tan head. Palate is light, smooth and semi dry. Good fine carbonation. Airy creamy malt. Spices. Little rich fruits. Light semi dry finish. Not bad.
Fles @ bierbrouwen lissebroek. Mooi donkerbier creme kleur. Aroma is choco gebrande mout. Smaak is vanilia, zoet.

Drinking blind from a 75cl bottle.
In the aroma alcohol, sweetness, roast malt, coffee
The clear dark brown beer has a small off-white head.
In the taste liquorice, chocolate, coffee.
Low carbonated.
0,75l fles gedeeld met nikos, donker bruin bier met een beige schuimkraag. Smaak en geur met caramel en cacao. Lekker bier, al komt ie qua body wel iets te kort om echt een topper te zijn.
75CL bottle at home, black beer with a medium head, aroma is malt, chocolate, some coffee. Taste is malts, dark chocolate, coffee, fruit. Nice
Bottle. Brown beer, white-ish head. Smooth aroma of wheat. Taste of fruity yeasty, chocolate and wheat. Soft mouthfeel. Like a dunkel weizen with chocolate.

Bottle from sharrow vale beer shop. Dark brown with a tan head. Subtle Aroma of chocolate and burnt butter, slightly nutty and rich with roasted malts. Lovely balanced taste very malty with a lasting clean aftertaste and slight alcohol warmth. Full bodied with some oil and tingly carbonation.

Bottle thnx to McTapps. Pours a clear dark brown beer with a medium sized off white head on top. Chocolate is very present in the nose, as well as a big malty aroma touches of roast. Flavor is moderately bitter, some light chocolate touches and an earthy base. Id expected this to be a bit more sweeter, but its actually quite bitter and well carbonated. Nice one, but I wouldve loved more chocolate in the flavor though.
A dark brown chocolate malt with creamy head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, a bit chocolate. Taste is bitter.
Botella de 75 cl, adquirida en La Birra. Color marron oscuro. Sabor a malta tostada, chocolate, dulce.
Couleur brune sombre, légère mousse beige. Nez malt grillé et chocolat. Gout malt grillé, café doux, chocolat, sucre candy en fin. Corps bien cremeux, cappuccino. Super douce et buvable!

750 ml bottle, pours cola black brown with a small off white head, rich rich roasty malt aroma, chocolate, dry gainy malt, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long dry finish.
Brown with beige medium head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee and caramel. Taste is coffee, chocolate and dark malts.

Hazy, dark brown color. Tall, medium-lasting beige head. Quite impressive lacing. Aroma of malts, alcohol, caramel, hints of chocolate and dark fruits. Taste has similar notes, its quite sweet. Medium carbonation with nice, smooth mouthfeel. Ive never been a big fan of bocks but this one is quite enjoyable.

Aroma: dark malts, roasted caramel, bitter chocolate.
Appearance: hazy dark brown color, beige head.
Taste: medium bitterness, roasted malts and caramel, bitter chocolate, quite sweet, some hints of alcohol.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, chocolate finish.
Overall: Pretty good stuff, nice interesting taste.

Grote fles uit een getränkemarkt. Donkerbruin van kleur, crêmige kraag. Ruikt naar mokka, metaal, romig. Smaakt wat rokerig, koffie. De full body uit de beschrijving kan ik niet beamen, de afdronk trekt toch wat dunnetjes weg.
Mørk, mørk brun med et beige skum. Aroma av malt, karamell og sjokolde. Smaken følger aroma, men her er det noe frukt i tilegg.

Bottle 75 cl.
Dark brown, beige head. Moderate malty, caramel, toasted bread. Sweet flavour with chocolate and malt. Dry finish.

750ml bottle from Bier-Deluxe. Thanks aQ!


Really deep brown colour with a tiny head. Aroma of mild choco. Flavour of cold chocolate and some sweetness.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, roasted malt, chocolate. Flavour is chocolate, roasted malt, hop, caramel. Medium body. Nice/OK beer.

Bottle. Pours very dark brown with a big beige head. The aroma is Deep malty with light chocolate notes. Some roast. The flavor is light roasted with light fruity and nutty notes. Good malty with some chocolate.
Dunkelbraun, schaumig im Glas. Kakaonoten, Malz, Röstmalz in der Nase. Am Gaumen süßlich, karamellig, Schokolade und Kaffee im Abgang. Schmelziges Mundgefühl.

Bottle from Lekkerbier, BB 16.12.15, large sample, served in a tulip glass. Dark color, medium brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, licorice, bit fruity like blackberries, dark bread. Quite dry and roasty in taste, bitter, not much sweetness, but just enough to make it nicely balanced. Medium carbonation, medium body. I was pleasantly surprised.

750 ml bottle kindly shared by djoeye. Unclear red-brown body under a fair, fawn-coloured head. Faint lacing. Smell of cocoa powder and earth. Milk chocolate flavour joined by earth and mid-sweet fruits. Malty sweetness to the ending. Fine bodied. Nice but rather unvaried (session at Finns in Tromsø, 05.08.2014).

02.08.2014, 0,75l bottle @ hotel room in Hamburg:
Big light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is rich and roasted, coffee, roasted grain, burnt caramel, dark malts, nuts, hay, cocoa, rye bread, toast. Taste is rich, roasted grain, coffee, burnt caramel, nuts, hay, dark malts, chocolate, grass, toast, rye bread. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice.

Bottle: Thanks Douberd: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized creamy beige head on top of a deepndark brown colored beer.
Aroma has lots of malts and chocolate malts with light herval roast and some smooth hints of marzipan and grass.
Flavour has also lots of malts and chocolate notes with a somewhat strong and strange bitterness. Also some herbal tones, toast, dried leaves, some banana peel with the slightest hint of something light marshmellow alike.
Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, malts, toast/roast, chocolate, some strange bitters and herbal toast.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, good medium bodied and a creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Chocolate, coffee, vanilla aromas. Dark Brown with tan head. Caramel, bread, chocolate, toast flavor. Low carbonation. Medium sweet finish.

Flaske 750ml spandert av djoeye. Delt med ham og Rune på Nerstranda 5 Aug 14. Dyp amber. Nesten svart. Lavt, litt farget skum som etterlater spot-lacing. Aroma av sjokolade. Smaken er nøtter & sjokolade med en svakt syrlig undertone. Bra - men ensformig.

Cocoa milky foam with bubbles.
Foggy red brown body. Milky lacings.
Aroma; cocoa, chocolate, nuts, malts, lots of brown spices. Taste; chocolate malts, hidden roasted almonds, dark chocolate, hops, lots of cocoa-related spices.
Good body. Alcohol is perfectly wrapped in the taste and not detectable.
Wide chocolate finish. A nice sipper, maybe a bit to stereotype on all that sweet dark chocolate stuff, but I guess that was Marcs intention.

75cl bottle at home. Clearish dark brown with a medium off-white head with medium retention. Medium to full body with light to moderate carbonation. Sweet with bitter tones. Roasted malts, chocolate, brown sugar, caramel, some raisin and vanilla. A more then decent German brew.

0,75 l bottle. Darkest brown, nearly black in the glass, big creamy tanned head. Dark fruity and alcoholic on the nose. Starts dark fruity and sweet, with dark malt in the background. Later more coffie and/or black chocolate. Light dryness. Not a fast and easy to drink beer.

Bottle from Desmonds Next Door, Kimmage, Dublin [250714]
Very dark brown, clear, thick frothy beige head, some lacing
Aroma of dark malts, savoury notes, some dark fruits
Taste of dark malts, some plain dark chocolate, mellow roast, dark caramel, alcohol quite well hidden, dab of toffee, seems a bit simple to me for the abv
Palate - soft carb, medium body, smooth texture. Quite sweet, fairly rich mouth feel. Finish as main flavour, some dusty dry cocoa in the tail, finish a bit short
Overall - OK, decent enough, but flavour a little duller that expected

Bottle. Clear, very dark, brown, with medium beige head. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, bread and dark chocolate, wonderful. Taste is light sweet, a bit sour and delightful bitter. Aftertaste is dark chocolate with coffee and dark malt, great. Palae is a bit too flat with a medium to thin body.

0.75 L bottle. Pours a clear red color with a one-finger lively but short-lived beige head. Sweet aroma of chocolate, malt and caramel. Taste is of malt, caramel, dark berries and clear notes of chocolate. Medium body and carbonation. Sweet but not overly so. Aftertaste is of roasted malt, caramel and chocolate with a slightly bitter finish. Very smooth and tasty but a bit tame. I think its very good but nothing super special. I would love to have it again though.

750ml bottle, 05/07/14. Pours a dark brown with a good-sized, beige-colored head. Aroma is rather Belgian strong-like with yeast, marzipan and caramel, but also the doppelbock like dark fruity maltiness. Taste is yeasty and marzipany too, but a lot of dark, sweet bread with loads of dark fruits: Dates, prune. Semi-sweet, but dries up toward the finish. Quite full with not much carbonation. A doppelbock (thats what it is) that approaches Belgian-style strong ales with its yeasty flavor.

Bottle shared at #EBBC14 courtesy of beer messiah, thanks Dean!spicey, woody toffee attractive dark ruby, fine beige head. touch of Marmite, full bodied, moderate carbonation, sweet, slightly chalky, dry cocoa, complex but hard going. better than many bocks though!

Bottle. Pours dark brown in color with a tan head. Notes of roasted malts, bitter chocolate and cold coffee in aroma. Semi-bitter chocolate, some roasted malts mostly in taste, perhaps some notes of dark berries are present underneath as well. So smooth mouthfeel, just like black velvet. Awesome brew with the smooth chocolate being all over the place here. A masterpiece.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks troubles. Dark brown with a yellowish head. A little smoky and a little chocolate aroma, bitter taste with some ash and a little alcohol, full body, carbonated, slightly burnt finish.

75 cl bottle on June 6, 2014, BB 27.02.16. From a store in Hannover.Black color, smallish light brown head. Sweet, roasted, malty scent. Roasted, malty, light toasted, smooth taste. Roasted aftertaste. Medium sort of fizzy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

Bottle. Dark brown, cloudy, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and roasted malt, light chocolate. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, light caramel and some roasted malt with light dark bread, light alcohol. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, light caramel and light roasted malt - faint burnt malt with light dark bread, faint chocolate and light alcohol. Sweetish bock with roastiness. OK but really nothing special.

0,7 bottle shared
Appearance: Dark brown color with a long lasting off white head (2 fingers), leaving light lacing
Aroma: Chocolate and roasted and some caramelised malts
Taste: Fruity start with some caramelised malts then goes over in a finish with a more nutty taste, however in the finish the dark chocolate nicely pours trough.
Medium body, good carbonation

Now this definately brings what the label says
A Dark bock beer with some hints of a porter. And that is nicely done.
Not the boldest thing out there but quite thought over and it works nicely.

Brown, beige head, good lace. Sweet, malts, chocolate, lightly roasted, banana, hint of citrus. Full, silky, flavourful.
Aroma of dark malts, chocolate, nuts, cappuccino. Flavour is toasty, chocolate, sweet, with a little bitterness in the finish. Very enjoyable and easy to drink.

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours hazy blackish dark brown with a big frothy brown head that quickly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is malty with dark bread, dark chocolate, roasted malts, burnt cereal, hay and soil. Taste is tiny sweet, slightly bitter, very tiny sour and malty with roasted malts, cocoa powder, soil, hay, burnt caramel, toasted cereal, Schwarzwald cake, roasted hazelnuts and hints of burnt wood. Bottle. A dense, two-finger light beige head leaves nice curtains. Lager-aroma with some apple hints, chocolate notes, caramel, raisins, sweet licorice notes, some alcohol and a faint smoked hint. Very smooth on the palate, with a soft carbonation and a little warming touch. Caramel, chocolate notes, dried fruits and a little bitterness in the flavor, leading to a caramel finish with some chocolate and dried fruits. A bit too lagerish this one, but nice and easy drinkable. 140426

Bottle 750ml @ Geokkjer
[Trade by McTapps] Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, chocolate and caramel, Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long caramel and chocolate finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle.Pours dark brown with a creamy off-white head. Aroma of malt, some roasted notes, herbs and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some roasted notes, caramel, chocolate and reins. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks troubles. Pours an hazy brown with a beige head, aroma of chocolate, nuts, malt, flavor of chocolate, nuts and malt, medium bodied.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks troubles. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma ofm alt, caramel, chocolate, light roastiness and a faint smoky hint. Sweetish flavor with chocolate, roast, caramel, nuts and a drier and more roasty finish. Medium-bodied. Not bad.

75cl bottle. Bb 13-11-15. Dark brown, thick white head, perfect look. Aroms is very bready, mild chocolate, nutty notes. Flavor is similar, bready, nutty, bitter chocolate when cold, that fades away later. Too high carbonation. Otherwise an enjoyable bock, pleasant, not too sweet either.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle 750ml (BDLX)
Dark borwn color, steady creamy beige head. Aroma has caramel, dark fruits and hints of alcohol. Medium-bodied. Caramel, some artifical kind chocolate, low bitterness. Sweetness covers the most of alcohol. Not my kind of bock, not at least German style one.
Bottle. Dark brown black color with a longlasting off-white head. Roasted malty chocolate aroma. Roasted malty chocolate and caramel flavor. Gas a roadted malty chocolate finish.

Bottle 750 ml at home, into a snifter. ABV 7.5%
Pours a very dark brown beer, with a tall, almost two fingers of tan head, thick and creamy, with good retention. Medium lace on the glass.
Aroma of milky chocolate, light caramel, nougat chocolate, a bit of nuts.
Very nice taste, fruity at first and after that, every now and then. As the fruity notes fade the chocolate kicks in. Some toasted malts too, light caramel in between, nutty flavours on the finish, with a dark chocolate bitterness on the aftertaste.
Medium body, good carbonation. Quite dry on the palate.
Very tasty bock.

750ml bottle. Ruby red glowing, dark brown colour with average, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, beige head. Malty aroma has notes of cocoa, nuts, a touch of nougat. Taste is dry malty with a nuttily touch, minimally chocolately, cocoa, grassy hoppy overtones.

Bottle, thanks to Ronny (rlgk), split at Colin and the Vikings tasting, Nol, Goteborg, Sweden 22/03/14.
Light black with moderate tan spotting/edgeing.
Nose is cardboard, sweet tones, cocoa, dark toffee fudge.
Taste comprises cocoa powder, dark fruits, toffee, light spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok stuff, a little basic for the ABV but ticks the style boxes with a chocolate twist.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: On bottle with Visionthing , thanks a lot! Brown color, good foam. Aromas if chocolate , quite distinct, also malt and some dried fruits. Medium/ full body & complexity. On the sweet side, some balancing bitterness . Enjoyable

75cl bottle from Ambrosetti, Berlin. Pours clear dark brown with a beige head. Mild roasty aroma with chocolate, malt, caramel and some dark bready notes. Medium sweet and chocolaty with a bslanced bitterness a a light dryness in the finish. Medium+ with fairly average carbonation. Pleasant one!

Sort skum råhvid meget lang 
Choklade kaffe lidt røg tømmer 
Bitter lidt sød modrate 
Cremet blød

Barwa: ciemno brązowa, pod światło głęboko rubinowa, wyraźnie zmętniona (nieładne grube, kłaczki). Piana koloru kremowego, drobno pęcherzykowa, średnio obfita i szybko opadająca. 

Aromat: słodki karmel, melanoidyny, suszone śliwki, ciemne owoce. Niewielki akcent czekoladowy. 

Smak: słodowy, dość pełny, umiarkowanie słodki. Spieczone ciasto, czekolada gorzka oraz goryczkowy i alkoholowy koniec.

W teorii bardzo interesujące piwo. W praktyce już tak świetnie niestety nie jest i to nie dlatego, iż w ostatnim czasie "wyleczyłem" się z koźlaków, które wcześniej były jednym z moich ulubionych stylów. Zdecydowany minus należy się za brzydkie zmętnienie. Na szczęście widać je tylko pod światło. Druga sprawa to przytłaczające nuty melanoidynowe, za którymi nie przepadam, podobnie, jak za aromatem suszonych śliwek. Tutaj niestety występują one w nadmiarze, kosztem zapowiadanej czekoladowości. Dostałem to piwo w prezencie, więc nie powinienem narzekać, ale wiem, że kosztuje minimum 30 złotych. Za tą cenę moim zdaniem nie warto.

Dark opaque color with a big off-white head. Aroma is quite roasted malt with hints of chocolate and coffee. Flavor is like aroma but a little bit more sweet. Soft carbonation and medium body with a dry bitter coffee-chocolate finish.

How: Bottle.
Where: Tasting at Colin and the Vikings. Courtesy of rlgk.
Appearance: Black colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Vinegar, raisin, dried fruit, malt, chocolate.
Body: Light to medium body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, vinous, malt, chocolate.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, stark schokoladig. Geschmack röstmalzig, trocken, schokoladig, Karamell.
Murky brown with small tan head. Nice lacing. Roasted and sweet aroma. Dry and spicy taste, dark chocolate. Dried fruit later on, discrete alcohol. Nice.
Bottle 0,75ltr: Very dark brown coloured brew with an dry bitter taste and lots of chocolate hints. Very nice innovation from this traditional Bavarian brewery.
Bottle (75 cl), courtesy of rlgk. Shady deep chestnut, medium beige head. Fruity and caramelly malt aroma with some chocolate. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Semi dry, low to medium bitterness.

Bottle at the "Colin and the Vikings tasting, Goteborg". Poured a clear dark brown with no life at all. The aroma is malt light chocolate. The flavour is medium bitter with a light slightly watery malt bitter palate. Light bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at Colin And The Vikings in Nol 2014-03-22. Black beer with a small brownish head. Malty chocolate aroma, caramel, cocoa powder, licorice, raisins, some biscuits. Chocolate flavor, caramel, figs, cocoa, alcohol is well hidden, some licorice showing late.

ASPETTO: marrone molto scuro quasi nero con leggeri riflessi violacei in controluce, schiuma color nocciola, fine e compatta , buona presenza e persistenza. OLFATTO: profumi torrefatti, con leggere note cioccolatose, sensazioni vanigliate e zucchero a velo, un vago fruttale che ricorda a tratti prugne secche , sentori alcolici. GUSTO: inizio dolce, dove si notano maggiormente sapori di cioccolato, melassa che poi sciamano lentamente lasaciando crescere i torrefatti, amarognoli che chiudono con sentori alcolicI che scaldano e rendono speziato il finale. TEXTURE: corpo medio, vellutata al palato , media carbonazione. COMMENTO FINALE: Bock scura interessante , resa originale da un tocco torrefatto particolamente marcato. le note cioccolatose contribuiscono alla rotondità e corposità permettendo un avvolgente sensazione in bocca. ulteriore conferma della qualità di questa serie "con amici".

Bottle from McTapps. Pours clear dark ruby with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma of dark chocolate and light roasted malts. Smooth and light creamy mouthfeel. Taste is malty, roasted, with a decent chocolate addition, light sweet, but pleasant and easy drinkable, well hidden alcohols.

Poured deep dark reddish brown with a dense tan head. Aroma of nuts, sweet milk chocolate, toasted malt. Medium body, flavour is moderately sweet, lactic, lightly bitter chocolate, fudge and light coffee.

750 ml bottle, from Alcampo Gran Canaria. ABV is 7.5%. Dark brown colour, large beige head. Moderately roasty aroma with hints of chocolate and dark berries. The flavour is malty but not too sweet, notes of pumpernickel bread and chocolate, hints of berries and coffee in the finish.

Bottle @ holiday inn Lübeck. Schiuma beige fine e poco persistente, consistenza cremosa. Birra ramati carico velata, ai limiti dell opalescente. Aroma fruttato, frutta secca datteri e anche nocciole. Cacao amaro, toffee e caramello anche presenti. dolce amabile, ritrovo la frutta secca, abbastanza tostata, caramello e cacao amaro. Equilibrata, rotonda, abbastanza corposa non molto carbonara..

Despite its presented as "interpretation of an Irish stout", id rather position it as a damn good doppelbock, but with steel hoppy eggs. I definitely support the idea of 0,7L bottle. As for beer - cant say better than offial info, ablolutely confirmed. But dont be deluded, despite all those berries and chololates, it is still viril and rough enough to been drunk by men)
Denominarla dunkler bock non rende lidea. Questa birra è veramente saporita, con note di cioccolato e caffé e un finale finemente amaro. Una "tedescata" molto molto originale e gustosa!

Bottle from bier-deluxe.de.dark red brown color with thick persistent light beige head. Roasted malt, coffee in aroma. Taste, roasted malt, milk chocolate, roasted coffee beans, vanilla, caramel. Not sweet, not bitter, balanced, tasty.

Black color, huge beige head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste of roasted malt, caramel, coffee. Slightly bitterness in finish and aftertaste. Very good beer.

Brown with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt. Flavor with caramel, chocolate and wheat

courtesy of fiulijn - very dark brown beer with a beige foam left; chocolatey and coffeish, toasted aroma; medium to full malt backbone, tart and bitter; cacao-like finish, otasted biscuits and more chocolatey notes
Bottle. Dark brown colour with beige head. Aroma and flavour of chocolate, caramel, licorice, roasted malt and fruity notes.

Confident Anglo-German style blend, ideal with/in dessert, to share.

Bottle @ unibaren, 20 / 7 2013. Dark brown, medium off white head that settles quickly, okay lacing. Aroma, malty, chocolate, toffee, bread, . Taste, roasted malts, bitter chocolate, caramel, . Bitter dry chocolate aftertaste.

Es ist ein tolles BIer, es ist vollmundig und voller Aromen, nur scheinen sich diese mit der Trinkzeit und dem offenen Glas wohl zu verflüchtigen. The beer pours out of the bottle in a deep dark brown / blackish colour with creamy low head and medium-smooth body. Nose of coffee and caramel. Taste of bittersweet chocolate, sugared mild espresso, cappuccino, rich intense malt, dark roasted caramel and rum. No real bitterness at all, very mild, easy and smooth to drink. Vanilla and fruity finish. I enjoyed it a lot and I hope the guys from Maisel & Friends go on with the great job they do.

Bottle.
Very dark. Sweet chocolate, coffee, red pepper. Silky. But not very exciting.

75cl bottle from Liebick Getränke in Germering. Pours a deep brown colored body with a finger-width, creamy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Lightly roasted and bitter throughout with a nice, somewhat sweet and rich malt backing. Chocolate, some toffee-bread, and caramel with a few dark fruit notes and touches of licorice. Finishes lightly sweetened and moderately bitter with a light alcohol warmth, touches of roast, and a nice chocolate note. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium-full body and a soft, somewhat lively carbonation. Overall, a really enjoyable beer. Smooth and malty with a nice sweetness balanced by a solid bitterness and roast element. Good one.
0.75l bottle. Dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, caramel and maybe plums. Tastes like chocolate, caramel and some dark fruits. Meduim body, creamy texture. Very nice beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with airy light tan head. Dark, slightly roasty aroma of malt, caramel, and dark chocolate. Sweetish, malty flavour with notes of roast, caramel and dark chocolate. Sweetish, slightly rough aftertaste. Decent.

light chocolate aroma,brown/golden, clear, light brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, soft carbonation, light watery chocolate finish.
